definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to
the target eNB to request the preparation of resources for a handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source eNB → target eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: MME UE S1AP ID
elementList.description: MME UE S1AP ID allocated at the MME

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes necessary QoS parameters

elementList.name: UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint
elementList.description: SGW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs.

elementList.name: RRC Context
elementList.description: Includes the RRC HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [9], or the RRC HandoverPreparationInformation-NB message as defined in 10.6.2 of TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting

elementList.name: UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: UE History Information
elementList.description: Same definition as in TS 36.413 [4]

elementList.name: Mobility Information
elementList.description: Information related to the handover; the source eNB provides it in order to enable later analysis of the conditions that led to a wrong HO.

elementList.name: UE History Information from the UE
elementList.description: VisitedCellInfoList contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: UE Context Reference at the SeNB
SeNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the SeNB

elementList.name: SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the SeNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: UE Context Reference at the WT
UE Context Reference at the SgNB
SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the SgNB.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256

PLMNs in the Management
  Based MDT PLMN list. Value is 16.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the CHO Trigger IE is present and set to "CHO-replace".

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target eNB to
inform the source eNB about the prepared resources at the target.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target eNB → source eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint
elementList.description: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of UL PDUs

elementList.name: DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint
elementList.description: Identifies the X2 transport bearer. used for forwarding of DL PDUs

elementList.name: E-RABs Not Admitted List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RABs Admitted List IE and in E-RABs Not Admitted List IE.

elementList.name: Target eNB To Source eNB Transparent Container
elementList.description: Includes the RRC E-UTRA Handover Command message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 in TS 36.331 [9]

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: WT UE Context Kept Indicator
elementList.description: Indicates that the WT has acknowledged to keep the UE context

elementList.name: E-RABs transferred to MeNB
elementList.description: In case of EN-DC, indicates that SN Status is needed for the listed E-RABs from the SgNB..

elementList.name: Requested Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Target cell indicated in the corresponding HANDOVER REQUEST message

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256

definitionList.name: HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target eNB to
inform the source eNB that the Handover Preparation has failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target eNB → source eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: Requested Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Target cell indicated in the corresponding HANDOVER REQUEST message

definitionList.name: SN STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to
the target eNB to transfer the uplink/downlink PDCP SN
and HFN status during a handover or for EN-DC.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source eNB → target eNB (handover), eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred → eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred (RRC connection re-establishment or dual connectivity), MeNB/en-gNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred → en-gNB/MeNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred (EN-DC).

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred

elementList.name: E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer List
E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item
Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs
elementList.description: PDCP Sequence Number = (First Missing SDU Number + bit position) modulo 4096 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number that the target eNB/en-gNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN in this release. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value Extended
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value Extended
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target eNB/en-gNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.82
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.82
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target eNB/en-gNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred.

elementList.name: SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for EN-DC at the SgNB.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target eNB to
the source eNB to indicate that resources can be released.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target eNB → source eNB (handover), MeNB → SeNB (dual connectivity), MeNB → en-gNB (EN-DC).

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity at the SeNB.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the MeNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity at the SeNB.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the MeNB.

elementList.name: SIPTO Bearer Deactivation Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that SIPTO@LN PDN connection deactivation is needed.

elementList.name: SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for EN-DC at the SgNB.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER CANCEL
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to
the target eNB to cancel an ongoing handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source eNB → target eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: Candidate Cells To Be Cancelled List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be prepared for a
  conditional handover. Value is 8.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER SUCCESS
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target eNB to
the source eNB to indicate the successful access of the UE toward the target
eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target eNB → source eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Target cell indicated in the corresponding Handover Preparation procedure

definitionList.name: CONDITIONAL HANDOVER CANCEL
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target eNB to
the source eNB to cancel an ongoing conditional handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target eNB → source eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB

elementList.name: Candidate Cells To Be Cancelled List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be prepared for a
  conditional handover. Value is 8.

definitionList.name: EARLY STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to
the target eNB to transfer the COUNT value related to the forwarded downlink
SDUs during DAPS Handover or Conditional Handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source eNB → target eNB (DAPS Handover or Conditional Handover).

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for DAPS handover or Conditional handover at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for DAPS handover or Conditional handover at the target eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for DAPS handover or Conditional handover at the source eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for DAPS handover or Conditional handover at the target eNB

elementList.name: E-RABs Subject To Early Status Transfer List
E-RABs Subject To Early Status Transfer Item
FIRST DL COUNT Value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number of the first DL SDU that the source eNB/MeNB forwards to the target eNB/en-gNB in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: FIRST DL COUNT Value Extended
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number of the first DL SDU that the source eNB/MeNB forwards to the target eNB/en-gNB in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: FIRST DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.82
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number of the first DL SDU that the source eNB/MeNB forwards to the target eNB/en-gNB in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: E-RABs Subject To DL Discarding List
E-RABs Subject To DL Discarding Item
DISCARD DL COUNT Value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number for which the target eNB/en-gNB should discard forwarded DL SDUs associated with lower values in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DISCARD DL COUNT Value Extended
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number for which the target eNB/en-gNB should discard forwarded DL SDUs associated with lower values in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DISCARD DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.82
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number for which the target eNB/en-gNB should discard forwarded DL SDUs associated with lower values in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: LOAD INFORMATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to
neighbouring eNBs to transfer load and interference co-ordination information.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

elementList.name: Cell ID
elementList.description: Id of the source cell

elementList.name: Target Cell ID
elementList.description: Id of the cell for which the HII is meant

elementList.name: Intended UL-DL Configuration
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6,…)
elementList.description: One of the UL-DL configurations defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL subframe(s) in the indicated configuration is subset of those in SIB1 UL-DL configuration. This IE applies to TDD only.

elementList.name: Extended UL Interference Overload Info
elementList.description: This IE applies to TDD only.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: ERROR INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is used to indicate that some
error has been detected in the eNB/en-gNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2 or eNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → eNB.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity at the SeNB or the eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the MeNB or the eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred.

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity at the SeNB or the eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity at the MeNB or the eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred.

elementList.name: Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for EN-DC at the en-gNB.

definitionList.name: X2 SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a
neighbouring eNB to transfer the initialization information for a TNL
association.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 à eNB2.

elementList.name: Served Cells
elementList.description: Complete list of cells served by the eNB

elementList.name: ECGI
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD. If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: NR Neighbour Information
elementList.description: NR neighbour, capable of performing EN-DC with the served E-UTRA cell

elementList.name: GU Group Id List
elementList.description: List of all the pools to which the eNB belongs

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

Maximum no. of neighbour cells associated to a
  given served cell. Value is 512.

Maximum no. of pools an eNB can belong to.
  Value is 16.

definitionList.name: X2 SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a
neighbouring eNB to transfer the initialization information for a TNL
association.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

elementList.name: Served Cells
elementList.description: Complete list of cells served by the eNB

elementList.name: ECGI
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD. If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: NR Neighbour Information
elementList.description: NR neighbour, capable of performing EN-DC with the served E-UTRA cell

elementList.name: GU Group Id List
elementList.description: List of all the pools to which the eNB belongs

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

Maximum no. of neighbour cells associated to a
  given served cell. Value is 512.

Maximum no. of pools an eNB can belong to.
  Value is 16.

definitionList.name: X2 SETUP FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate
X2 Setup failure.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: RESET REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent from one eNB to
another eNB/en-gNB or from en-gNB to an eNB and is used to request the X2
interface between the two eNB or between an eNB and an en-gNB to be reset.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2, eNB → en-gNB, en-gNB → eNB.

definitionList.name: RESET RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by a eNB/en-gNB as a
response to a RESET REQUEST message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1, eNB → en-gNB, en-gNB → eNB.

definitionList.name: ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer
eNB to transfer updated information for a TNL association.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

elementList.name: Served Cells To Add
elementList.description: Complete list of added cells served by the eNB

elementList.name: ECGI
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD. If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: NR Neighbour Information
elementList.description: NR neighbour, capable of performing EN-DC with the served E-UTRA cell

elementList.name: Served Cells To Modify
elementList.description: Complete list of modified cells served by the eNB

elementList.name: Old ECGI
elementList.description: Old E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier

elementList.name: ECGI
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell Identifier of the neighbour cell

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD. If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: NR Neighbour Information
elementList.description: NR neighbour, capable of performing EN-DC with the served E-UTRA cell

elementList.name: Deactivation Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that the concerned cell is switched off for energy saving reasons

elementList.name: Served Cells To Delete
elementList.description: Complete list of deleted cells served by the eNB

elementList.name: Old ECGI
elementList.description: Old E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the cell to be deleted

elementList.name: GU Group Id To Add List
GU Group Id To Delete List
Coverage Modification List
elementList.description: List of cells with modified coverage

elementList.name: ECGI
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of the cell to be modified

elementList.name: Cell Coverage State
elementList.description: Value '0' indicates that the cell is inactive. Other values Indicates that the cell is active and also indicates the coverage configuration of the concerned cell

elementList.name: Cell Deployment Status Indicator
elementList.description: Indicates the Cell Coverage State is planned to be used at the next reconfiguration

elementList.name: ECGI
elementList.description: E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier of a cell that may replace all or part of the coverage of the cell to be modified

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

Maximum no. of neighbour cells associated to a
  given served cell. Value is 512.

Maximum no. of pools an eNB can belong to.
  Value is 16.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Cell
  Deployment Status Indicator IE is present.

definitionList.name: ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer
eNB to acknowledge update of information for a TNL association.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: ENB CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer
eNB to indicate eNB Configuration Update Failure.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB1
to neighbouring eNB2 to initiate the requested measurement according
to the parameters given in the message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

elementList.name: eNB1 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB1

elementList.name: eNB2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB2

elementList.name: Registration Request
elementList.description: Type of request for which the resource status is required.

elementList.name: Report Characteristics
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates measurement object the eNB2 is requested to report. First Bit = PRB Periodic, Second Bit = TNL load Ind Periodic, Third Bit = HW Load Ind Periodic, Fourth Bit = Composite Available Capacity Periodic, this bit should be set to 1 if at least one of the First, Second or Third bits is set to 1, Fifth Bit = ABS Status Periodic, Sixth Bit = RSRP Measurement Report Periodic, Seventh Bit = CSI Report Periodic. Other bits shall be ignored by the eNB2.

elementList.name: Cell To Report
elementList.description: Cell ID list to which the request applies.

elementList.name: Reporting Periodicity
elementList.description: Periodicity that can be used for reporting of PRB Periodic, TNL Load Ind Periodic, HW Load Ind Periodic, Composite Available Capacity Periodic or ABS Status Periodic.

elementList.name: Partial Success Indicator
elementList.description: Included if partial success is allowed

elementList.name: Reporting Periodicity of RSRP Measurement Report
elementList.description: Periodicity that can be used for the reporting of RSRP Measurement Report Periodic.

elementList.name: Reporting Periodicity of CSI Report
elementList.description: Periodicity that can be used for the reporting of CSI Report Periodic.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Registration
  Request IE is set to the value "stop", "partial stop"
  or "add".

definitionList.name: RESOURCE STATUS RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB2
to indicate that the requested measurement, for all or for a subset of the
measurement objects included in the measurement is successfully initiated.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

elementList.name: eNB1 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB1

elementList.name: eNB2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB2

elementList.name: Measurement Initiation Result
elementList.description: List of all cells in which measurement objects were requested, included when indicating partial success

elementList.name: Measurement Failure Cause List
elementList.description: Indicates that eNB2 could not initiate the measurement for at least one of the requested measurement objects in the cell

elementList.name: Measurement Failed Report Characteristics
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates measurement object that failed to be initiated in the eNB2. First Bit = PRB Periodic, Second Bit = TNL load Ind Periodic, Third Bit = HW Load Ind Periodic, Fourth Bit = Composite Available Capacity Periodic, Fifth Bit = ABS Status Periodic, Sixth Bit = RSRP Measurement Report Periodic, Seventh Bit = CSI Report Periodic. Other bits shall be ignored by the eNB1.

elementList.name: Cause
elementList.description: Failure cause for measurement objects for which the measurement cannot be initiated

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of measurement objects that can
  fail per measurement. Value is 32.

Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: RESOURCE STATUS FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB2
to indicate that for none of the requested measurement objects the measurement
can be initiated.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

elementList.name: eNB1 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB1

elementList.name: eNB2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB2

elementList.name: Cause
elementList.description: Ignored by the receiver when the Complete Failure Cause Information IE is included

elementList.name: Complete Failure Cause Information
elementList.description: Complete list of failure causes for all requested cells

elementList.name: Measurement Failed Report Characteristics
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates measurement object that failed to be initiated in the eNB2. First Bit = PRB Periodic, Second Bit = TNL load Ind Periodic, Third Bit = HW Load Ind Periodic, Fourth Bit = Composite Available Capacity Periodic, Fifth Bit = ABS Status Periodic, Sixth Bit = RSRP Measurement Report Periodic, Seventh Bit = CSI Report Periodic. Other bits shall be ignored by the eNB1.

elementList.name: Cause
elementList.description: Failure cause for measurements that cannot be initiated

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

Max number of measurement objects that can fail
  per measurement. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by eNB2 to
neighbouring eNB1 to report the results of the requested
measurements.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

elementList.name: eNB1 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB1

elementList.name: eNB2 Measurement ID
elementList.description: Allocated by eNB2

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: MOBILITY CHANGE REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB1
to neighbouring eNB2 to initiate adaptation of mobility parameters.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

elementList.name: eNB1 Mobility Parameters
elementList.description: Configuration change in eNB1 cell

elementList.name: eNB2 Proposed Mobility Parameters
elementList.description: Proposed configuration change in eNB2 cell

definitionList.name: MOBILITY CHANGE ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB2
to indicate that the eNB2 Proposed Mobility Parameter proposed by
eNB1 was accepted.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB2
to indicate that the eNB2 Proposed Mobility Parameter proposed by
eNB1 was refused.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: RLF INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB2
to indicate an RRC re-establishment attempt or a reception of an RLF
Report from a UE that suffered a connection failure at eNB1.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

elementList.name: Failure cell PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell Identifier

elementList.name: C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI contained in the RRC Re-establishment Request message (TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: ShortMAC-I
elementList.description: ShortMAC-I contained in the RRC Re-establishment Request message (TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: RLF -Report-r9 IE contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: RRC Conn Setup Indicator
elementList.description: Included if the RLF Report within the UE RLF Report Container IE is retrieved after an RRC connection setup or an incoming successful handover

elementList.name: RRC Conn Reestab Indicator
elementList.description: The Reestablishment Cause in RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message(TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: UE RLF Report Container for extended bands
elementList.description: RLF-Report-v9e0 IE contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: NB-IoT RLF Report Container
elementList.description: RLF-Report-NB-r16 IE contained in the UEInformationResponse-NB message (TS 36.331 [9])

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB1
to report a handover failure event or other critical mobility problem.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

elementList.name: Handover Report Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (HO too early, HO to wrong cell, …, InterRAT ping-pong, Inter System ping-pong)

elementList.name: Handover Cause
elementList.description: Indicates handover cause employed for handover from eNB2

elementList.name: Source cell ECGI
elementList.description: ECGI of source cell for handover procedure (in eNB2)

elementList.name: Failure cell ECGI
elementList.description: ECGI of target cell for handover procedure (in eNB1)

elementList.name: Re-establishment cell ECGI
elementList.description: ECGI of cell where UE attempted re-establishment

elementList.name: Target cell in UTRAN
elementList.description: Encoded according to UTRAN Cell ID in the Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information IE, as defined in in TS 25.413 [24]

elementList.name: Source cell C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI allocated at the source eNB (in eNB2) contained in the AS-config (TS 36.331 [9]).

elementList.name: Mobility Information
elementList.description: Information provided in the HANDOVER REQUEST message from eNB2.

elementList.name: UE RLF Report Container
elementList.description: The UE RLF Report Container IE received in the RLF INDICATION message.

elementList.name: UE RLF Report Container for extended bands
elementList.description: The UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE received in the RLF INDICATION message.

elementList.name: Target cell in NG-RAN
elementList.description: Encoded according to NG-RAN CGI IE in TS 38.413 [39].

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Handover
  Report Type IE is set to the value "HO to wrong cell"

This IE shall be present if the Handover
  Report Type IE is set to the value "InterRAT ping-pong"

This IE shall be present if the Handover Report
  Type IE is set to the value "Inter-system ping-pong"

definitionList.name: CELL ACTIVATION REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer
eNB to request a previously switched-off cell(s) to be re-activated.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: CELL ACTIVATION RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer
eNB to indicate that one or more cell(s) previously switched-off has(have) been
activated.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: CELL ACTIVATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer
eNB to indicate cell activation failure.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: X2 RELEASE
descriptionList:
This message is used to indicate that the signalling
connection to an eNB is unavailable.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 à eNB2.

definitionList.name: X2AP MESSAGE TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is used for indirect transport
of an X2AP message (except the X2AP MESSAGE TRANSFER message) between two eNBs, and to allow an eNB to perform registration.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 → eNB2.

elementList.name: X2AP Message
elementList.description: Includes any X2AP message except the X2AP MESSAGE TRANSFER message

definitionList.name: X2 REMOVAL REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a
neighbouring eNB to initiate the removal of the signaling connection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB1 à eNB2.

definitionList.name: X2 REMOVAL RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by an eNB to a neighbouring
eNB to acknowledge the initiation of removal of the signaling connection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: X2 REMOVAL FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate
that removing the signaling connection cannot be accepted.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB2 → eNB1.

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the new eNB to
request the old eNB to transfer the UE Context to the new eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new eNB → old eNB.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the new eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the new eNB See Note 1)

elementList.name: ShortMAC-I
elementList.description: RRC Resume: Corresponds to the ShortResumeMAC-I in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [9] RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to the ShortMAC-I in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequestmessage as defined in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: New E-UTRAN Cell Identifier
elementList.description: RRC Resume: Corresponds to the cellIdentity within the VarShortResumeMAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [9]. RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to the cellIdentity within the VarShortMAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI contained in the RRC Re-establishment Request message (TS 36.331 [9]). If this IE is present, the Resume ID IE is ignored

elementList.name: Failure cell PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell Identifier

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the old eNB to
transfer the UE context to the new eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old eNB → new eNB.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the new eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the new eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the old eNB

elementList.name: Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the old eNB

elementList.name: MME UE S1AP ID
elementList.description: MME UE S1AP ID allocated at the MME

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes necessary QoS parameters

elementList.name: UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint
elementList.description: SGW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs.

elementList.name: RRC Context
elementList.description: Includes either the RRC Handover Preparation Information message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [9], or the HandoverPreparationInformation-NB message as defined in subclause 10.6.2 of TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting

elementList.name: UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the old eNB to
inform the new eNB that the Retrieve UE Context procedure has failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old eNB → new eNB.

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the new eNB

elementList.name: New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the new eNB

elementList.description: NR neighbours.

elementList.description: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served NR Cells IE

elementList.description: NR neighbours

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an eNB.

descriptionList:
This message is sent by an en-gNB to a peer

definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → eNB.

elementList.name: EN-DC SON Configuration Transfer
elementList.description: Contains the EN-DC SON Configuration Transfer IE as defined in TS 36.413 [4].

definitionList.name: EN-DC RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to the en-gNB to initiate the requested measurement according to the
parameters given in the message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB → en-gNB.

elementList.description: Allocated by the eNB

elementList.name: en-gNB Measurement ID

elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates measurement object the en-gNB is requested to report. First Bit = PRB Periodic, Second Bit = TNL Capacity Ind Periodic, Third Bit = Composite Available Capacity Periodic, Fourth Bit = Number of Active UEs. Other bits shall be ignored by the en-gNB.

elementList.name: Cell To Report EN-DC List

elementList.name: SSB To Report List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an

Maximum no. SSB Areas that can be served by a
  NG-RAN node cell. Value is 64.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Registration
  Request IE is set to the value "stop", or "add".

This IE shall be present if the Registration
  Request IE is set to the value "start".

to a peer en-gNB or by a neighbouring en-gNB to a peer eNB, both nodes able to
interact for EN-DC, to express the desired resource allocation for data
traffic, for the sake of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB → en-gNB, en-gNB → eNB.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
elementList.description: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic.

elementList.name: Spectrum Sharing Group ID
elementList.description: Indicates the E-UTRA cells involved in resource coordination with the NR cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.

elementList.name: List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Request
elementList.description: List of applicable E-UTRA cells.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
elementList.description: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic.

elementList.name: List of E-UTRA Cells in NR Coordination Request
elementList.description: List of applicable E-UTRA cells

elementList.name: Spectrum Sharing Group ID
elementList.description: Indicates the NR cells involved in resource coordination with the E-UTRA cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.

elementList.name: List of NR Cells in NR Coordination Request
elementList.description: List of applicable NR cells

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-UTRA cells in eNB. Value is
  256.

Maximum no. of NR cells affiliated to a
  Spectrum Sharing Group ID involved in cell resource coordination with a
  number of E-UTRA cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.
  Value is 64.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA – NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by a neighbouring eNB
to a peer en-gNB or by a neighbouring en-gNB to a peer eNB, both nodes able to
interact for EN-DC, as a response to the E-UTRA – NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION
REQUEST.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB → en-gNB, en-gNB → eNB.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
elementList.description: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic.

elementList.name: Spectrum Sharing Group ID
elementList.description: Indicates the E-UTRA cells involved in resource coordination with the NR cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.

elementList.name: List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Response
elementList.description: List of applicable E-UTRA cells

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
elementList.description: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic.

elementList.name: Spectrum Sharing Group ID
elementList.description: Indicates the NR cells involved in resource coordination with the E-UTRA cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.

elementList.name: List of NR Cells in NR Coordination Response
elementList.description: List of applicable NR cells

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-UTRA cells in eNB. Value is
  256.

Maximum no. of NR cells  affiliated to a Spectrum Sharing Group ID involved in cell resource coordination
  with a number of E-UTRA cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group
  ID. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: SGNB ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to
inform the MeNB that resources for E-RABs controlled by the en-gNB have not
been used or are in use again.
definitionList.direction: Direction: en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

elementList.name: SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the en-gNB.

elementList.name: UE Context level user plane activity report
MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256

definitionList.name: GNB STATUS INDICATION
descriptionList: This message is sent by the en-gNB to indicate to the eNB its status of overload.
definitionList.direction: Direction: en-gNB → eNB.

definitionList.name: TRACE START
descriptionList: This message is sent by the MeNB to initiate a trace session for a UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

elementList.name: SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the en-gNB.

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

definitionList.name: DEACTIVATE TRACE
descriptionList: This message is sent by the MeNB to deactivate a trace session.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

elementList.name: SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the en-gNB.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Trace ID
elementList.description: As per E-UTRAN Trace ID in Trace Activation IE

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

definitionList.name: UE Radio Capability ID Mapping Request
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the en-gNB and is
used to request the UE Radio Capability information that maps to a specific UE
Radio Capability ID.
definitionList.direction: Direction: en-gNB → eNB

definitionList.name: UE Radio Capability ID Mapping Response
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
to provide the UE Radio Capability information that maps to a specific UE Radio
Capability ID indicated in the UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING REQUEST message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB → en-gNB.

definitionList.name: F1-C TRAFFIC TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to the
MeNB or by the MeNB to the en-gNB to transfer the F1-C traffic to and from an
IAB-node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

elementList.name: SgNB UE X2AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the en-gNB.

elementList.name: F1-C Traffic Container
elementList.description: Contains an F1-C interface SCTP CHUNK and IP header. This IE corresponds to the DedicatedInfoF1AP-r16 defined in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension
elementList.description: Allocated at the MeNB.

definitionList.name: GTP Tunnel Endpoint
descriptionList:
The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE
identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport
bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP
Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be
used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user
plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to
be used for the user plane transport. The QoS Mapping Information is used to
set the IP header of packets in case that the en-gNB serves the IAB, and the
packets belonging to MN-terminated split bearer/SCG bearer are transmitted from
MeNB to en-gNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]

elementList.name: GTP TEID
elementList.description: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

definitionList.name: Trace Activation
descriptionList:
Defines parameters related to trace
activation.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Trace ID
elementList.description: The E-UTRAN Trace ID IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information coded as in 9.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (last 2 octets)

elementList.name: Interfaces To Trace
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a eNB interface: first bit =S1-MME, second bit =X2, third bit =Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1. Other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.

elementList.name: Trace Depth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED( minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, ...)
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.421 [7]

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]

elementList.name: MDT Configuration NR
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [39]. Only the immediate MDT configurations are included in the IE in this version of the specification.

definitionList.name: Handover Restriction List
descriptionList:
This IE defines roaming or access
restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the eNB provides
information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g.,
handover and CCO, or for SCG selection during dual
connectivity operation.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Equivalent PLMNs
elementList.description: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of "equivalent PLMNs list" as defined in TS 24.301 [14]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

elementList.name: Forbidden TAs
elementList.description: intra E-UTRAN roaming restrictions

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: The PLMN of forbidden TACs

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The forbidden TAC

elementList.name: Forbidden LAs
elementList.description: inter-3GPP RAT roaming restrictions

elementList.name: Forbidden inter RATs
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(ALL, GERAN, UTRAN, CDMA2000, …,GERAN and UTRAN, CDMA2000 and UTRAN)
elementList.description: inter-3GPP and 3GPP2 RAT access restrictions. "ALL" means that all RATs mentioned in the enumeration of this IE are restricted.

elementList.name: NR restriction in EPS as secondary RAT
elementList.description: Restriction to use NR when the NR is used as secondary RAT in EN-DC.

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restrictions
elementList.description: Includes any of the Serving PLMN or any PLMN of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which core network type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [38].

elementList.name: Core Network Type
elementList.description: The indication indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to 5GC or to EPC for this PLMN.

elementList.name: NR Restriction in 5GS
elementList.description: Restriction to use NR when the NR connects to 5GS.

elementList.name: Last NG-RAN PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Indicates the NG-RAN PLMN from where the UE formerly handed over to EPS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to 5GS.

elementList.name: Unlicensed Spectrum Restriction
elementList.description: Restriction to use unlicensed spectrum in the form of LAA or LWA/LWIP or NR-U as described in TS 23.401 [11].

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of equivalent PLMN Ids. Value is
  15.

Maximum no. of equivalent PLMN Ids plus one.
  Value is 16.

Maximum no. of forbidden Tracking Area Codes.
  Value is 4096.

Maximum no. of forbidden Location Area Codes.
  Value is 4096.

definitionList.name: PLMN Identity
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the PLMN
Identity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

definitionList.name: DL Forwarding
descriptionList:
This element indicates that the E-RAB is
proposed for forwarding of downlink packets.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the cause information
element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole
protocol.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified,...,Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object,TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload, CHO-CPC resources to be changed, UE Power Saving)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error,Abstract Syntax Error (Reject),Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify),Message not Compatible with Receiver State,Semantic Error,Unspecified,Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message),...)

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure,O&M Intervention,Not enough User Plane Processing Resources,Unspecified,...)

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is
sent by the eNB/en-gNB when
parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if
the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information
about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of IE errors allowed to be reported
  with a single message. The value for maxnooferrors is 256.

definitionList.name: Served Cell Information
descriptionList:
This IE contains cell configuration
information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: PCI
elementList.description: Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in SIB1 associated to the E-UTRA Cell Identity in the Cell ID IE.

elementList.name: UL EARFCN
elementList.description: Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [16] for E-UTRA operating bands for which it is defined; ignored for E-UTRA operating bands for which NUL is not defined

elementList.name: DL EARFCN
elementList.description: Corresponds to NDL in TS 36.104 [16]

elementList.name: UL Transmission Bandwidth
elementList.description: Same as DL Transmission Bandwidth in this release; ignored in case UL EARFCN value is ignored

elementList.name: UL EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the UL EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: DL EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the DL EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN
elementList.reference: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN 9.2.94
elementList.description: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16]

elementList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN
elementList.reference: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN 9.2.94
elementList.description: Corresponds to MUL in TS 36.104 [16]

elementList.name: NRS-NSSS-PowerOffset
elementList.description: NRS to NSSS power ratio, as defined in TS6.213 [11].

elementList.name: NSSS-NumOccasionDifferentPrecoder
elementList.description: The number of consecutive NSSS occasions that use different precoders for NSSS transmission, as defined in TS6.213 [11].

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: Corresponds to NDL/NUL in TS 36.104 [16]

elementList.name: Subframe Assignment
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6,…)
elementList.description: Uplink-downlink subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. In NB-IOT, sa0 and sa6 are not applicable.

elementList.name: Special Subframe Info
elementList.description: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: Special Subframe Patterns
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, …)

elementList.name: Additional Special Subframe Info
elementList.description: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. Only for newly defined configuration of special subframe from Release 11.

elementList.name: Additional Special Subframe Patterns
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, ssp9, …)

elementList.name: EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored.

elementList.name: Additional Special Subframe Extension Info
elementList.description: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. Only for newly defined configuration of special subframe from Release 14.

elementList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN
elementList.reference: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN 9.2.94
elementList.description: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16]

elementList.name: NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset
elementList.description: Corresponds to the TDD-UL-DL-AlignmentOffset-NB in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: MBSFN Subframe Info
elementList.description: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [9]

elementList.name: Radioframe Allocation Period
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(n1, n2, n4, n8, n16, n32, …)

elementList.name: MBMS Service Area Identity List
elementList.description: Supported MBMS Service Area Identities in the cell

elementList.name: MBMS Service Area Identity
elementList.description: MBMS Service Area Identities as defined in TS 23.003 [29]

elementList.name: FreqBandIndicatorPriority
elementList.description: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcasted in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: BandwidthReducedSI
elementList.description: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [9])

elementList.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List E-UTRA
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to the cellAccessRelatedInfo IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 36.331 [9]. All PLMN Identities and associated information contained in the cellAccessRelatedInfo IE are included and provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN IDs in SIB1 associated to the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Broadcast PLMN Ids. Value is 6.

Maximum no. of MBSFN
  frame allocation with different offset. Value is 8.
Maximum no. of MBMS Service Area Identities. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an
E-RAB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: QCI
elementList.description: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].

elementList.name: GBR QoS Information
elementList.description: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12].

elementList.name: Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12].

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum and
guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink.

NOTE:     For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR
QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured
with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates
signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the
MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12].

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12].

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12].

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12].

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits
delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE
in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the
duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or
guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is
transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit
Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate
Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified
in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all
Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink
direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.401 [12].

elementList.name: Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.401 [12].

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList:
The Message Type IE uniquely
identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

definitionList.name: ECGI
descriptionList:
The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI)
is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Cell Identifier
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the 12
bit PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit Hyper frame number.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: GUMMEI
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the
globally unique MME identity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: UL Interference Overload Indication
descriptionList:
This IE provides, per PRB, a report on
interference overload. The interaction between the indication of UL
Interference Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: UL Interference Overload Indication
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (high interference, medium interference, low interference, …)
elementList.description: Each PRB is identified by its position in the list: the first element in the list corresponds to PRB 0, the second to PRB 1, etc.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. Physical Resource Blocks. Value is
  110.

definitionList.name: UL High Interference Indication
descriptionList:
This IE provides, per PRB, a 2 level report
on interference sensitivity. The interaction between the indication of UL
Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: HII
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB (first bit=PRB 0 and so on), for which value ‘"1" indicates ‘high interference sensitivity’ and value "0" indicates ’low interference sensitivity’. The maximum number of Physical Resource Blocks is 110.

definitionList.name: Relative Narrowband Tx Power (RNTP)
descriptionList:
This IE provides an indication on DL power
restriction per PRB or per subframe per PRB (Enhanced RNTP) in a cell and other
information needed by a neighbour eNB for interference aware scheduling.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: RNTP Per PRB
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a nPRB value (i.e. first bit=PRB 0 and so on), for which the bit value represents RNTP (nPRB), defined in TS 36.213 [11]. Value 0 indicates "Tx not exceeding RNTP threshold". Value 1 indicates "no promise on the Tx power is given". The IE is ignored if the Enhanced RNTP IE is included.

elementList.name: RNTP Threshold
elementList.description: RNTPthreshold is defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: Number Of Cell-specific Antenna Ports
elementList.description: P (number of antenna ports for cell-specific reference signals) defined in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: P_B
elementList.description: PB is defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: PDCCH Interference Impact
elementList.description: Measured by Predicted Number Of Occupied PDCCH OFDM Symbols (see TS 36.211 [10]). Value 0 means "no prediction is available".

elementList.name: Enhanced RNTP Bitmap
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB in a subframe; value "00" indicates "Tx not exceeding RNTP Threshold", value "01" indicates "Tx not exceeding RNTP High Power Threshold", value "11" indicates that "no promise on the Tx power is given". Value "10" is ignored by the receiver". Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The first 2 bits correspond to PRB 0 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, the following 2 bits correspond to PRB 1 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, and so on. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The Enhanced RNTP pattern is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: RNTP High Power Threshold
elementList.description: Defined as the RNTPthreshold in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: Start SFN
elementList.description: SFN of the radio frame containing the first subframe when the Enhanced RNTP IE is valid.

elementList.name: Start Subframe Number
elementList.description: Subframe number, within the radio frame indicated by the Start SFN IE, of the first subframe when the Enhanced RNTP IE is valid.

definitionList.name: GU Group Id
descriptionList:
The GU Group Id IE is the globally
unique group id corresponding to a pool area.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Information
descriptionList:
This information element indicates how the
location information should be reported.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Global eNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is used to globally identify an eNB
(see TS 36.401 [2]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Macro eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB

elementList.name: Home eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

elementList.name: Short Macro eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

elementList.name: Long Macro eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

definitionList.name: E-RAB ID
descriptionList:
This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a
UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: eNB UE X2AP ID
descriptionList:
This information element, combined with the
eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies
an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB.

The usage of this IE is defined in TS
36.401 [2].

NOTE:     If X2-C signalling transport is shared
among multiple interface instances, the value of the
eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if
applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
descriptionList:
The Subscriber
Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp
priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in
Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency Priority

definitionList.name: Additional RRM Policy Index
descriptionList:
The Additional RRM Policy Index IE
is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency
priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: EARFCN
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel
Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL
or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: EARFCN
elementList.description: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of EARFCNs. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Transmission Bandwidth
descriptionList:
The Transmission Bandwidth IE is
used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of
resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1,
bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB"
6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Transmission Bandwidth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100,... , bw1)

definitionList.name: E-RAB List
descriptionList:
The IE contains a list of E-RAB identities with a cause value. It is
used for example to indicate not admitted bearers.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList:
The UE Security Capabilities IE
defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the
UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0 "first bit" - 128-EEA1, "second bit" - 128-EEA2, "third bit" - 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0 (TS 33.401 [18]) "first bit" - 128-EIA1, "second bit" - 128-EIA2, "third bit" - 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

definitionList.name: AS Security Information
descriptionList:
The AS Security
Information IE is used to generate the key material to
be used for AS security with the UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Key eNodeB Star
elementList.description: KeNB* defined in TS 33.401 [18]. If the target cell belongs to multiple frequency bands, the source eNB selects the DL-EARFCN for KeNB* calculation as specified in section 10.3 of TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: Next Hop Chaining Count
elementList.description: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.401 [18]

definitionList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio
Access Bearer.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Priority Level
