elementList.description: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
elementList.description: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

definitionList.name: Time To Wait
descriptionList:
This IE
defines the minimum allowed waiting times.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: SRVCC Operation Possible
descriptionList:
The IE indicates that both the UE and the
MME are SRVCC-capable. E-UTRAN behaviour on reception of this is specified in
TS 23.216 [20].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Hardware Load Indicator
descriptionList:
The Hardware Load Indicator IE
indicates the status of the Hardware Load experienced by the cell.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: S1 TNL Load Indicator
descriptionList:
The S1 TNL Load Indicator IE
indicates the status of the S1 Transport Network Load experienced by the cell.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Load Indicator
descriptionList:
The Load Indicator IE indicates the
status of Load.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Radio Resource Status
descriptionList:
The Radio Resource Status IE
indicates the usage of the PRBs for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink (TS 36.314 [22], TS 23.203 [13]) and the usage of PDCCH CCEs for Downlink and Uplink scheduling.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: UE History Information
descriptionList:
The UE History Information IE
contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state
prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [15].

NOTE:     The definition of this IE is aligned
with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 36.413 [4].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Last Visited Cell List
elementList.description: Most recent information is added to the top of this list

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of last visited cell information
  records that can be reported in the IE. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Last Visited Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited Cell Information may
contain cell specific information.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 25.413 [24]

elementList.name: Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [39]. (see subclause 9.3.1.97).

definitionList.name: Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
contains information about a cell that is to be used for RRM purposes.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Time UE stayed in Cell
elementList.description: The duration of the time the UE stayed in the cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095s, this IE is set to 4095.

elementList.name: Time UE stayed in Cell Enhanced Granularity
elementList.description: The duration of the time the UE stayed in the cell in 1/10 seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095s, this IE is set to 40950.

elementList.name: HO Cause Value
elementList.description: The cause for the handover from the E-UTRAN cell.

definitionList.name: Last Visited GERAN Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited Cell Information for GERAN
is currently undefined.

NOTE:     If in later Releases this is defined,
the choice type may be extended with the actual GERAN specific information.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: CHOICE Last Visited GERAN Cell Information

definitionList.name: Cell Type
descriptionList:
The cell type provides the cell coverage
area.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Number of Antenna Ports
descriptionList:
The Number of Antenna Ports IE is
used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Number of Antenna Ports
elementList.description: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports

definitionList.name: Composite Available Capacity Group
descriptionList:
The Composite Available Capacity Group
IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in Downlink and
Uplink.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Composite Available Capacity Downlink
elementList.description: For the Downlink

elementList.name: Composite Available Capacity Uplink
elementList.description: For the Uplink

definitionList.name: Composite Available Capacity
descriptionList:
The Composite Available Capacity IE
indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink
or Uplink.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Capacity Value
elementList.description: ‘0’ indicates no resource is available, Measured on a linear scale.

definitionList.name: Cell Capacity Class Value
descriptionList:
The Cell Capacity Class Value IE
indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other
cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources
that are configured for traffic purposes.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Cell Capacity Class Value
elementList.description: Value 1 shall indicate the minimum cell capacity, and 100 shall indicate the maximum cell capacity. There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value.

definitionList.name: Capacity Value
descriptionList:
The Capacity Value IE indicates the
amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources.
The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN
resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation.
The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell
capacity class values, if available.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Capacity Value
elementList.description: Value 0 shall indicate no available capacity, and 100 shall indicate maximum available capacity . Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale.

definitionList.name: Mobility Parameters Information
descriptionList:
The Mobility Parameters Information
IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current
value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell
initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour
cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take
place later.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Handover Trigger Change
elementList.description: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

definitionList.name: Mobility Parameters Modification Range
descriptionList:
The Mobility Parameters Modification
Range IE contains the range of Handover Trigger Change values
permitted by the eNB2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE
message is sent.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Handover Trigger Change Lower Limit
elementList.description: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

elementList.name: Handover Trigger Change Upper Limit
elementList.description: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

definitionList.name: PRACH Configuration
descriptionList: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: RootSequenceIndex
elementList.description: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration
elementList.description: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: HighSpeedFlag
elementList.description: TRUE corresponds to Restricted set and FALSE to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: PRACH-FrequencyOffset
elementList.description: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: PRACH-ConfigurationIndex
elementList.description: Mandatory for TDD, shall not be present for FDD. See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [10]

definitionList.name: Subframe Allocation
descriptionList:
The Subframe Allocation IE is used
to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame
allocation period as defined in
TS 36.331 [9].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: CSG Membership Status
descriptionList:
This element indicates the membership
status of the UE to a particular CSG.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: CSG ID
descriptionList:
This element indicates the identifier of
the Closed Subscriber Group.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: ABS Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides information about which
sub frames the sending eNB is configuring as almost blank subframes and which
subset of almost blank subframes are recommended for configuring measurements
towards the UE. Almost blank subframes are subframes with reduced power on some
physical channels and/or reduced activity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: ABS Pattern Info
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a DL subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS’ and value "0" indicates ’non ABS’. The first position of the ABS pattern corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The ABS pattern is continuously repeated in all radio frames. The maximum number of subframes is 40.

elementList.name: Number Of Cell-specific Antenna Ports
elementList.description: P (number of antenna ports for cell-specific reference signals) defined in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: Measurement Subset
elementList.description: Indicates a subset of the ABS Pattern Info above, and is used to configure specific measurements towards the UE.

elementList.name: ABS Pattern Info
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value "1" indicates ‘ABS’ and value "0" indicates ’non ABS’ which is applicable only in positions corresponding to the DL direction. The maximum number of subframes depends on UL/DL subframe configuration. The maximum number of subframes is 20 for UL/DL subframe configuration 1~5; 60 for UL/DL subframe configuration 6; 70 for UL/DL subframe configuration 0. UL/DL subframe configuration defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The first position of the ABS pattern corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The ABS pattern is continuously repeated in all radio frames, and restarted each time SFN = 0.

elementList.name: Number Of Cell-specific Antenna Ports
elementList.description: P (number of antenna ports for cell-specific reference signals) defined in TS 36.211 [10]

elementList.name: Measurement Subset
elementList.description: Indicates a subset of the ABS Pattern Info above, and is used to configure specific measurements towards the UE

elementList.name: ABS Inactive
elementList.description: Indicates that interference coordination by means of almost blank sub frames is not active

definitionList.name: Invoke Indication
descriptionList:
This IE provides an indication about which
type of information the sending eNB would like the receiving eNB to send back.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Invoke Indication
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ABS Information, …, Start NAICS Information, Stop NAICS Information)

definitionList.name: MDT Configuration
descriptionList:
The IE defines the MDT configuration
parameters.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: MDT Activation
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(Immediate MDT only, Immediate MDT and Trace, …)

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code. The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: Measurements to Activate
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates a MDT measurement, as defined in TS 37.320 [25]. First Bit = M1, Second Bit = M2, Third Bit = M3, Fourth Bit = M4, Fifth Bit = M5, Sixth Bit = logging of M1 from event triggered measurement reports according to existing RRM configuration. Seventh Bit = M6, Eighth Bit = M7. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate".

elementList.name: M1 Reporting Trigger
elementList.description: This IE shall be ignored if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "0".

elementList.name: M1 Threshold Event A2
elementList.description: Included in case of event-triggered or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1

elementList.name: Threshold RSRP
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: Threshold RSRQ
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: M1 Periodic reporting
elementList.description: Included in case of periodic or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1

elementList.name: Report interval
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( ms120, ms240, ms480, ms640, ms1024, ms2048, ms5120, ms10240, min1, min6, min12, min30, min60)
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: Report amount
elementList.description: Number of reports

elementList.name: MDT Location Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate". The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to "1".

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for MDT scope. Value is 32.
Maximum no. of TA subject for MDT scope. Value is 8.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the first bit set to "1" and the M1 Reporting
  Trigger IE is set to "A2event-triggered" or to "A2event-triggered
  periodic".

This IE shall be present if the M1 Reporting
  Trigger IE is set to "periodic" or to "A2event-triggered
  periodic".

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the third bit set to "1".

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the fourth bit set to "1".

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the fifth bit set to "1".

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1".

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1".

definitionList.name: ABS Status
descriptionList:
The ABS Status IE is used to aid the
eNB designating ABS to evaluate the need for modification of the ABS pattern.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: DL ABS status
elementList.description: Percentage of used ABS resources. The numerator of the percentage calculation consists of resource blocks within the ABS indicated in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE allocated by the eNB2 for DL traffic needing protection by ABS from inter-cell interference for DL scheduling, or allocated by the eNB2 for other reasons (e.g. some control channels). The denominator of the percentage calculation is the total quantity of resource blocks within the ABS indicated in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE.

elementList.name: Usable ABS Pattern Info
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS that has been designated as protected from inter-cell interference by the eNB1, and available to serve this purpose for DL scheduling in the eNB2’ and value "0" is used for all other subframes. The pattern represented by the bitmap is a subset of, or the same as, the corresponding ABS Pattern Info IE conveyed in the LOAD INFORMATION message from the eNB1.

elementList.name: Usable ABS Pattern Info
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS that has been designated as protected from inter-cell interference by the eNB1, and available to serve this purpose for DL scheduling in the eNB2’ and value "0" is used for all other subframes. The pattern represented by the bitmap is a subset of, or the same as, the corresponding ABS Pattern Info IE conveyed in the LOAD INFORMATION message from the eNB1.

definitionList.name: Management Based MDT Allowed
descriptionList:
This information element is used by the eNB
to allow selection of the UE for management based MDT as described in TS 32.422 [6].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: MultibandInfoList
descriptionList:
The MultibandInfoList IE contains
the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in
decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: FrequencyBandIndicator
elementList.description: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42, table 5.5-1]

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of frequency bands that a cell
  belongs to. The value is 16.

definitionList.name: M3 Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE defines the parameters for M3
measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: M4 Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE defines the parameters for M4
measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: M5 Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE defines the parameters for M5
measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: MDT PLMN List
descriptionList:
The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE
is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of PLMNs in the MDT PLMN list.
  Value is 16.

definitionList.name: EARFCN Extension
descriptionList:
The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel
Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given
direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: EARFCN Extension
elementList.description: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of EARFCNs. Value is 65535.
New maximum value of EARFCNs. Value is 262143.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value Extended
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the 15 bit long PDCP SN and the
corresponding 17 bit long Hyper Frame Number.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Extended UL Interference Overload Info
descriptionList:
This IE provides report on interference overload for the set of subframes that are subject
to UL-DL subframe reconfiguration. This IE applies to
TDD only.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Associated Subframes
elementList.description: The set of subframe(s) to which the Extended UL interference overload indication is applicable. The bitmap from the least significant bit position to the most significant bit position represents subframes #{3, 4, 7, 8, 9} in a radio frame. Value "1" in a bit position indicates that the Extended UL interference overload indication is applicable to the corresponding subframe; and value "0" indicates otherwise.

definitionList.name: RNL Header
descriptionList:
The RNL Header IE indicates the
target eNB ID and source eNB ID.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Masked IMEISV
descriptionList:
This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a
terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Masked IMEISV
elementList.description: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [29] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

definitionList.name: Expected UE Behaviour
descriptionList:
This IE
defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility
behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Expected HO Interval
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)
elementList.description: Indicates the expected time interval between inter-eNB handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter-eNB handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.

definitionList.name: Expected UE Activity Behaviour
descriptionList:
Indicates
information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in
TS 23.401 [12].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Expected Activity Period
elementList.description: If this IE is set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].

elementList.name: Expected Idle Period
elementList.description: If this IE is set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

elementList.name: Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information
elementList.description: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.

definitionList.name: SeNB Security Key
descriptionList:
The SeNB Security Key IE is
used to apply security in the SeNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: SeNB Security Key
elementList.description: The S-KeNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18].

definitionList.name: SCG Change Indication
descriptionList:
The SCG Change Indication IE is either used to request the SeNB
to prepare the SCG Change in the SeNB or to request the MeNB to initiate the
SCG Change towards the UE (see TS 36.300 [15]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: CoMP Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides
the list of CoMP hypothesis sets, where each CoMP hypothesis set is the
collection of CoMP hypothesis(es) of one or multiple cells and each CoMP
hypothesis set is associated with a benefit metric.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Benefit Metric
elementList.description: Value -100 indicates the maximum cost, and 100 indicates the maximum benefit. Value -101 indicates unknown benefit. Values from -100 to 100 should be calculated on a linear scale.

elementList.name: Start SFN
elementList.description: SFN of the radio frame containing the first subframe when the CoMP Information IE is valid.

elementList.name: Start Subframe Number
elementList.description: Subframe number, within the radio frame indicated by the Start SFN IE, of the first subframe when the CoMP Information IE is valid.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of CoMP
  Hypothesis sets. The value is 256.

definitionList.name: CoMP Hypothesis Set
descriptionList:
This IE provides a
set of CoMP hypotheses. A CoMP hypothesis is hypothetical PRB-specific resource
allocation information for a cell.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Cell ID
elementList.description: ID of the cell for which the CoMP Hypothesis IE is applied.

elementList.name: CoMP Hypothesis
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB in a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘interference protected resource’ and value "0" indicates ‘resource with no utilization constraints,’ which is applicable only in positions corresponding to the DL direction. The first bit corresponds to PRB 0 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, the second bit corresponds to PRB 1 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, and so on. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The length of the bit string is an integer (maximum 40) multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The CoMP hypothesis pattern is continuously repeated.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of cells in a CoMP hypothesis
  set. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: RSRP Measurement Report List
descriptionList:
This IE provides
RSRP measurement reports of UEs served by the sending eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: RSRP Cell ID
elementList.description: ID of the cell on which the RSRP is measured.

elementList.name: RSRP Measured
elementList.description: Measured RSRP. Defined in TS 36.331 [9].

elementList.name: UE ID
elementList.description: ID assigned by eNB2 for the UE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of UE measurement reports. Value
  is 128.

Maximum number of
  reported cells. The value is 9.

definitionList.name: Dynamic DL transmission information
descriptionList:
This IE contains assistance information for
DL interference mitigation.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Transmission Modes
elementList.description: The set bits indicate some or all transmission modes: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, as defined in TS 36.213 [23, 7.1]. The first/ leftmost bit is for transmission mode 1, the second bit is for transmission mode 2, and so on.

elementList.name: P_A
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (dB-6, dB-4dot77, dB-3, dB-1dot77, dB0, dB1, dB2, dB3,...)
elementList.description: See PA TS 36.213 [23, 5.2]. Value dB-6 corresponds to -6 dB, dB-4dot77 corresponds to -4.77 dB etc.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no of PA values that can be
  configured. Value is 3.

definitionList.name: ProSe Authorized
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the authorization status of the UE for ProSe service(s).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: ProSe Direct Discovery
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Discovery

elementList.name: ProSe Direct Communication
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Communication

elementList.name: ProSe UE-to-Network Relaying
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized to act as ProSe UE-to-Network Relay

definitionList.name: CSI Report
descriptionList:
This IE provides
CSI reports of UEs served by the cell for which the information is provided.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: UE ID
elementList.description: ID assigned by eNB2 for the UE.

elementList.name: CSI Process Configuration Index
elementList.description: Indicates one of the possible CSI Process configurations in the serving cell.

elementList.name: CSI Report per CSI Process Item
RI
elementList.description: The RI corresponding to the CQI being reported for this CSI process item. Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: Subband Size
elementList.description: Corresponds to a value of subband size k defined in TS 36.213 [11] for the system bandwidth.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum number of UE. Value is 128.
Maximum number of CSI processes per UE. The value is 4.

Maximum number of CSI Reports per CSI Process.
  The value is 2.

Maximum number of
  subbands. The value is 14.

definitionList.name: Wideband CQI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Wideband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Wideband CQI Codeword 0
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 4-bit CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 3-bit spatial differential CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

definitionList.name: Subband CQI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Subband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: 4-bit CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 2-bit Subband differential CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 2-bit differential CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 4-bit CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 3-bit spatial differential CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 2-bit Subband differential CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

elementList.name: 2-bit differential CQI
elementList.description: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the 18
bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame Number.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: LHN ID
descriptionList:
The LHN
ID IE is used to indicate
the LHN ID of the eNB, as defined in TS 23.003 [29].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Local Home Network ID
elementList.description: Identifies the Local Home Network.

definitionList.name: Correlation ID
descriptionList:
This information
element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier or GRE
key to be used for the user plane transport between eNB
and the L-GW described in TS
23.401 [12].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: UE Context Kept Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates that the UE Context at
the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS
36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
descriptionList:
This information element combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID uniquely
identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. If the setup of an UE
associcated signalling connection was initiated including the eNB UE X2AP ID
Extension, the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension shall be used by both peers for the
life-time of the respective UE-associated signalling connection.
The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2].

NOTE:     If X2-C signalling transport is shared
among multiple interface instances, the value of the
eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, is allocated so that it can be associated
with an X2-C interface instance.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: M6 Configuration
descriptionList: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: M6 Delay Threshold
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)

conditionList.explanation: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

definitionList.name: M7 Configuration
descriptionList: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: M7 Collection Period
elementList.description: Unit: minutes

definitionList.name: Tunnel Information
descriptionList:
The Tunnel Information IE indicates
the transport layer address and UDP port number.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: eNB’s Transport Layer Address.

elementList.name: UDP Port Numbers
elementList.description: UDP Port Numbers if NAT/NAPT is deployed in the BBF access network.

definitionList.name: X2 Benefit Value
descriptionList:
The X2 Benefit Value IE indicates
the quantified benefit of the signalling connection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: X2 Benefit Value
elementList.description: Value 1 indicates low benefit, and 8 indicates high benefit.

definitionList.name: Resume ID
descriptionList:
The Resume ID IE is used to address
a suspended UE Context within an eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Resume ID not truncated
elementList.description: 40 bit Resume Resume Identity contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message (TS 36.331 [9]). The 20 most significant bits refer to the eNB ID of the eNB that allocated the Resume ID, the 20 least significant bits identify the UE Context stored at the eNB that allocated the Resume ID.

elementList.name: Resume ID truncated
elementList.description: 24 bit Resume Identity contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message (TS 36.331 [9]). The 12 most significant bits refer to the 12 least significant bits of the eNB ID of the eNB that allocated the Resume ID. The 12 least significant bits refer to the 12 least significant bits that identify the UE Context stored at the eNB that allocated the Resume ID.

definitionList.name: Bearer Type
descriptionList:
This IE is used to support Non-IP data as
specified in TS 23.401 [11].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: V2X Services Authorized
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the authorization status of the UE to use the
sidelink for V2X services.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Vehicle UE
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Vehicle UE

elementList.name: Pedestrian UE
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Pedestrian UE

definitionList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate the offset of
the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN

definitionList.name: WT ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to identify a WT.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: WT UE XwAP ID
descriptionList:
The WT UE XwAP ID is allocated by the WT and uniquely
identifies a UE over the Xw interface.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the aggregate maximum bit rate for all radio bearers per UE in the sidelink for V2X services.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Value 0 shall be considered as a logical error by the receiving eNB.

definitionList.name: NR Neighbour Information
descriptionList:
This IE contains cell configuration
information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NRPCI
elementList.description: NR Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: 5GS-TAC
elementList.description: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

elementList.name: Configured TAC
elementList.description: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].

elementList.name: Measurement Timing Configuration
elementList.description: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

elementList.name: Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR
elementList.description: Contains the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE as defined in TS 38.423 [49].

elementList.name: CSI-RS Transmission Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates the CSI-RS transmission status of the given cell.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of neighbour NR cells associated to
  a given served cell. Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Extended Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits
delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided
by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum
or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Extended Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: en-gNB UE X2AP ID
descriptionList:
This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2
interface within an en-gNB.
The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2].

NOTE:     If X2-C signalling transport is shared
among multiple interface instances, the value of the
en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: SgNB Security Key
descriptionList:
The SgNB Security Key IE is
used to apply security in the en-gNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: SgNB Security Key
elementList.description: The S-KgNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18].

definitionList.name: Target SgNB ID Information
descriptionList:
This IE contains the target SgNB ID used by MeNB to find the target
en-gNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: SCG Configuration Query
descriptionList:
The SCG Configuration Query IE is used
to request the en-gNB to provide current SCG configuration.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Delivery Status
descriptionList:
This IE defines the Delivery Status IE of
RRC Transfer message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP Sequence Number
elementList.description: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in 38.323 [33].

definitionList.name: NR Frequency Info
descriptionList:
The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier
frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or
for both UL and DL directions in TDD.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NRARFCN
elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

elementList.name: NR Frequency Band
elementList.description: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

elementList.name: Supported SUL band Item
elementList.description: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2.-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

elementList.name: Frequency Shift 7p5khz
elementList.description: Indicate whether the value of Δshift is 0kHz or 7.5kHz when calculating FREF,shift as defined in Section 5.4.2.1 of TS 38.104 [37].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of NRARFCNs. Value is 3279165.

Maximum no. of frequency bands supported for a
  NR cell. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: NR UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList:
This IE defines the supported algorithms
for encryption and integrity protection in NR as
defined in TS 33.401 [18].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NR Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, "first bit" – 128-NEA1, "second bit" – 128-NEA2, "third bit" – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

elementList.name: NR Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, "first bit" – 128-NIA1, "second bit" – 128-NIA2, "third bit" – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

definitionList.name: EN-DC Resource Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE contains the EN-DC resource
configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and
Lower Layers at MCG and SCG.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: PDCP Change Indication
descriptionList:
The PDCP Change
Indication IE is used to require
the MeNB to either initiate the security key update or
to perform PDCP data recovery towards the UE (see TS 37.340 [15]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: PDCP Change Indication
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (S-KgNB update required, PDCP data recovery required, …)
elementList.description: The value of S-KgNB update required indicates that the security key in en-gNB needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that MeNB needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

definitionList.name: Served NR Cell Information
descriptionList:
This IE contains cell configuration
information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP
interface.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NR-PCI
elementList.description: NR Physical Cell ID

elementList.name: 5GS-TAC
elementList.description: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code. If this IE is included, the receiving node may assume that the NR cell provides 5GS service and is eligible as inter-system HO target candidate.

elementList.name: Configured TAC
elementList.description: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].

elementList.name: Served PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMNs in SIB1 associated to the NR Cell Identity in the Cell ID IE. If more than maxnoofBPLMNs are needed for NR, they are provided by the Additional PLMNs IE.

elementList.name: UL Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the UL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: DL Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the DL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: TDD UL-DL Configuration Common NR
elementList.description: The tdd-UL-DL-ConfigurationCommon IE in TS 38.331 [31]

elementList.name: Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR
elementList.description: Contains the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE as defined in TS 38.423 [49].

elementList.name: Measurement Timing Configuration
elementList.description: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the served cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

elementList.name: Additional PLMNs
elementList.description: Additional PLMNs in addition to the Served PLMNs

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR
elementList.description: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [31]. All PLMN Identities and associated information contained in the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE are included and provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

elementList.name: Broadcast PLMNs
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN IDs in SIB1 associated to the NR Cell Identity IE

elementList.name: NR Cell PRACH Configuration
elementList.description: Containing 9.3.1.139 NR Cell PRACH Configuration as of TS 38.473 [44].

elementList.name: CSI-RS Transmission Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates the CSI-RS transmission status of the given cell.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of broadcast PLMN Ids. Value is 6.
Maximum no. additional PLMN Ids. Value is 6.

Maximum no. of extended broadcast PLMN Ids.
  Value is 12.

definitionList.name: NR CGI
descriptionList:
The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is
used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

definitionList.name: Global en-gNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is used to globally identify an
en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: en-gNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the en-gNB.

definitionList.name: NR Transmission Bandwidth
descriptionList:
The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is
used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NR SCS
elementList.description: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [37].

elementList.name: NR NRB
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)
elementList.description: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [37]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.

definitionList.name: Cell Assistance Information
descriptionList:
The Cell Assistance Information IE
is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: CHOICE Cell Assistance Type
elementList.description: This IE may be refined.

elementList.name: List of Requested NR Cells
elementList.description: Included when the eNB requests a limited list of served NR cells.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested.

elementList.name: Complete Information Request Indicator
elementList.description: Included when the eNB requests the complete list of served NR cells.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. cells that can be served by an
  en-gNB. Value is 16384.

definitionList.name: MeNB Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList:
The MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE is LTE resource allocation at MeNB and used at the en-gNB to
coordinate resource utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: EUTRA Cell ID
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PCell.

elementList.name: UL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: DL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the assumed PSCell.

definitionList.name: SgNB Resource Coordination Information
descriptionList:
The SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the PCell which are
not available for use by the MeNB and is used at the MeNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the
en-gNB and the MeNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NR CGI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PSCell.

elementList.name: UL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: DL Coordination Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

elementList.name: EUTRA Cell ID
elementList.description: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE.

definitionList.name: UL Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is
configured for the assisting node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: UL UE Configuration
elementList.description: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the assisting node.

definitionList.name: RLC Mode
descriptionList:
The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC
Mode used for an E-RAB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Secondary RAT Usage Report List
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the NR resources used with EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Start timestamp
elementList.description: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [35]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

elementList.name: End timestamp
elementList.description: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [35]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

elementList.name: Usage count UL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

elementList.name: Usage count DL
elementList.description: The unit is: octets.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs. Value is 256.

Maximum no. of time reporting periods. Value is
  2.

definitionList.name: UE Application layer measurement configuration
descriptionList:
The IE defines configuration information
for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Container for application layer measurement configuration
elementList.description: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.

elementList.name: Service Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
elementList.description: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for QMC scope. Value is 32.
Maximum no. of TA subject for QMC scope. Value is 8.

Maximum no. of PLMNs in the PLMN list for QMC
  scope. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: DRB ID
descriptionList:
This information element uniquely
identifies a DRB over the X2 interface within an en-gNB.

The usage of this IE is defined in TS
36.331 [9].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: SUL Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides information about the SUL
carrier.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: SUL ARFCN
elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

elementList.name: Carrier List
elementList.description: If included, the SUL Transmission Bandwidth IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Frequency Shift 7p5khz
elementList.description: Indicate whether the value of Δshift is 0kHz or 7.5kHz when calculating FREF,shift as defined in Section 5.4.2.1 of TS 38.104 [37].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum value of NRARFCNs. Value is 3279165.

definitionList.name: Packet Loss Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the packet loss rate.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

definitionList.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the resources allocated
for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as
protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA – NR
Cell Resource Coordination.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List
elementList.description: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List Item
elementList.description: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.

elementList.name: Resource Type
elementList.description: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

elementList.name: Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint
elementList.description: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs. is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern
elementList.description: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time Pattern
elementList.description: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time-periodicity
elementList.description: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Start Time
elementList.description: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

elementList.name: PDCCH Region Length
elementList.description: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. protected resource patterns. Value
  is 16.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the intended data traffic
resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resources
descriptionList:
The Data Traffic Resources IE
indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell
Resource Coordination.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resources
elementList.description: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

definitionList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
descriptionList:
The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE
indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource
Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Subframe Type
elementList.description: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value '1' indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node's subframe 0 in a receiving node's radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the eNB.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

definitionList.name: Aerial UE subscription information
descriptionList:
This information element is used by the eNB
to know if the UE is allowed to use aerial UE function, refer to TS 23.401[12].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: User plane traffic activity report
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate user plane
traffic activity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: User plane traffic activity report
elementList.description: "re-activated" shall be only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

definitionList.name: RLC Status
descriptionList:
This IE indicates about the RLC
configuration change included in the container towards the UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Reestablishment Indication
elementList.description: Indicates that following the change of the radio status, the RLC has been re-established.

definitionList.name: RRC config indication
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate the type of RRC
configuration used at the en-gNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: PDCP SN Length
descriptionList:
The PDCP SN Length IE is used to
indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Length
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.

definitionList.name: Bluetooth Measurement Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE defines the parameters for
Bluetooth measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Bluetooth Measurement Configuration Name Item IEs
BT RSSI
elementList.description: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Bluetooth local name used for
  Bluetooth measurement collection, the maximum value is 4.

definitionList.name: WLAN Measurement Configuration
descriptionList: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: WLAN Measurement Configuration Name Item IEs
WLAN RSSI
elementList.description: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].

elementList.name: WLAN RTT
elementList.description: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of WLAN SSID used for WLAN measurement collection, the maximum
  value is 4.

definitionList.name: Subscription Based UE Differentiation Information
descriptionList:
This IE is generated by the MME based on
the UE subscription information, it provides the Subscription Based UE
differentiation Information.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Periodic Communication Indicator
elementList.description: This IE indicates whether the UE communicates periodically or not, e.g. only on demand.

elementList.name: Periodic Time
elementList.description: This IE indicates the interval time of periodic communication, the unit is: second

elementList.name: Scheduled Communication Time
elementList.description: This IE indicates the time zone and day of the week when the UE is available for communication.

elementList.name: Day of Week
elementList.description: If Day-Of-Week is not provided this shall be interpreted as every day of the week. Each position in the bitmap represents a day of the week: first bit = Mon, second bit =Tue, third bit =Wed, and so on. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘scheduled. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘not scheduled’.

elementList.name: Time of Day Start
elementList.description: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. If Time-Of-Day-Start is not provided, starting time shall be set to start of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.

elementList.name: Time of Day End
elementList.description: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. The value of this IE should be bigger than the value of Time of Day Start IE. If Time-Of-Day-End is not provided, ending time is end of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.

elementList.name: Traffic Profile
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(single packet, dual packets, multiple packets, …)
elementList.description: "single packet" indicates single packet transmission (UL or DL), "dual packets" indicates dual packet transmission (UL with subsequent DL, or DL with subsequent UL), "multiple packets" indicates multiple packets transmission.

elementList.name: Battery Indication
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(battery powered, battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable, not battery powered, …)
elementList.description: "battery powered" indicates that the UE is battery powered and the battery is rechargeable/replaceable, "battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable" indicates that the UE is battery powered but the battery is not rechargeable/replaceable, "not battery powered" indicates that the UE is not battery powered.

definitionList.name: Duplication activation
descriptionList:
The Duplication Activation IE
indicates whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: LCID
descriptionList:
This IE uniquely identifies a LCID for the
associated DRB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: LCID
elementList.description: Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [8].

definitionList.name: MeNB Coordination Assistance Information
descriptionList:
The MeNB Coordination Assistance
Information IE is provided by the MeNB and used by the SgNB to determine
further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: MeNB Coordination Assistance Information
elementList.description: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required.

definitionList.name: SgNB Coordination Assistance Information
descriptionList:
The SgNB Coordination Assistance
Information IE is provided by the SgNB and used by the MeNB to determine
further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: SgNB Coordination Assistance Information
elementList.description: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required.

definitionList.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
descriptionList:
This IE contains information on which level
activity notification shall be performed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Location Information at SgNB
descriptionList:
The Location Information at SgNB IE
enables the SgNB to provide the MeNB with information that supports
localisation of the UE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: PSCell ID
elementList.description: PSCell of the UE

definitionList.name: Interface Instance Indication
descriptionList:
The Interface Instance Indication
identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for.

NOTE:     The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated
with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one
interface instance.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate the offset
between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency
center.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset
elementList.description: Unit: kHz

definitionList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate that lower
layer resources’ presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is
set to "release lower layers" or
"suspend lower layers", PDCP entities, X2-U
bearer resources, S1-U bearer resources and UE context information shall be
kept.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, suspend lower layers, resume lower layers ...)
elementList.description: "re-establish lower layers" shall be only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated. “resume lower layers” shall restore SCG. "resume lower layers" shall be only set after "suspend lower layers" has been indicated.

definitionList.name: Cell and Capacity Assistance Information
descriptionList:
The Cell and Capacity Assistance
Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR or E-UTRA
cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Maximum Cell List Size
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum size the
sending node can handle for a given list.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Message Oversize Notification
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum number of
cells that can be received in the List of Served
Cells NR IE.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: TNL Transport Layer Address Info
descriptionList:
This IE is used for signalling IP addresses
of IP-Sec endpoints used for establishment of IP-Sec tunnels.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add List
Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add Item
IP-Sec Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.

elementList.name: GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add Item
GTP Transport Layer Address Info
elementList.description: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.

elementList.name: Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Remove List
Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Remove Item
IP-Sec Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.

elementList.name: GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item
GTP Transport Layer Address Info
elementList.description: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Transport Layer Addresses in the
  message. Value is 16

Maximum no. of GTP Transport Layer Addresses
  for a GTP end-point in the message. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: CP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This element is used to provide the
transport layer information associated with EN-DC X2
control plane transport.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: TNL Association Usage
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
the usage of the TNL association.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: TNL Association Usage
elementList.description: Indicates whether the TNL association is only used for UE-associated signalling, or non-UE-associated signalling, or both.

definitionList.name: RAN UE NGAP ID
descriptionList:
This IE uniquely identifies the UE
association over the NG interface within the NG-RAN node, as specified in TS
38.413 [39].
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: EPC Handover Restriction List Container
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Handover
Restriction List IE specified in TS 36.413 [4] as received by the E-UTRAN
from the EPC.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: EPC Handover Restriction List Container
elementList.description: The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the Handover Restriction List IE specified in TS 36.413 [4].

definitionList.name: DAPS Request Information
descriptionList:
The DAPS Indicator IE indicates that
the source eNB requests a DAPS HO for the concered E-RAB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: DAPS Indicator
elementList.description: Indicates that DAPS HO is requested

definitionList.name: DAPS Response Information
descriptionList:
The DAPS Response Indicator IE
indicates the response to a requested DAPS Handover for the concerned E-RAB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: DAPS Response Indicator
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (DAPS HO accepted, DAPS HO not accepted, …)
elementList.description: Indicates that DAPS Handover is accepted or not.

definitionList.name: Maximum Number of CHO Preparations
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum number of CHO
preparations for a UE towards a candidate target eNB.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: Ethernet Type
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate that Ethernet
data is expected.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

definitionList.name: NR V2X Services Authorized
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the authorization status of the UE to use the NR
sidelink for V2X services.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: Vehicle UE
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Vehicle UE.

elementList.name: Pedestrian UE
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Pedestrian UE.

definitionList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
on the Aggregate Maximum Bitrate of the UE’s sidelink communication for NR V2X services.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MeNB → en-gNB or en-gNB → MeNB.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Value 0 shall be considered as a logical error by the receiving eNB.

definitionList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE provides information
